com.facebook.litho.widget

Class EditText

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.litho.ComponentLifecycle
      • com.facebook.litho.Component
        • com.facebook.litho.widget.EditText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Equivalence<Component>, EventDispatcher, EventTriggerTarget, HasEventDispatcher, HasEventTrigger, java.lang.Cloneable
    Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public final class EditText
extends Component
    This class is Deprecated and will not be supported. Use TextInput instead.

    Component that renders an EditText.

    See Also:
    com.facebook.litho.widget.EditTextSpec

    • Optional Props

        • cursorDrawableRes

          Drawable to set for the edit texts cursor.
          Type:
          int

        • editable

          If set, allows the text to be editable.
          Type:
          boolean

        • editorActionListener

          Special listener to be called when an action is performed
          Type:
          android.widget.TextView.OnEditorActionListener

        • ellipsize

          If sets, specifies the position of the text to be ellispized.
          Type:
          android.text.TextUtils.TruncateAt

        • extraSpacing

          Extra spacing between the lines of text.
          Type:
          float

        • gravity

          Gravity for the text within its container.
          Type:
          int

        • highlightColor

          The color to apply to highlights within the text.
          Type:
          int

        • hint

          Hint text to display.
          Type:
          java.lang.CharSequence

        • hintColor

          The color to apply to the hint text.
          Type:
          int

        • hintColorStateList

          A {@link ColorStateList to use for the hint text}.
          Type:
          android.content.res.ColorStateList

        • imeOptions

          Type of data in the text field, reported to an IME when it has focus.
          Type:
          int

        • initialText

          Initial text to display. This only takes effect if the text prop is null. If set, the value is set on the EditText exactly once: on initial mount. From then on, the EditText's text property is not modified.
          Type:
          java.lang.CharSequence

        • inputFilters

          Type:
          java.util.List

        • inputType

          Type of data being placed in a text field, used to help an input method decide how to let the user enter text.
          Type:
          int

        • isSingleLine

          If set, makes the text to be rendered in a single line.
          Type:
          boolean

        • isSingleLineWrap

          If set, single line text would warp and horizontal scroll would be disabled only works when isSingleLine is set.
          Type:
          boolean

        • linkColor

          The color to apply to links within the text.
          Type:
          int

        • maxLength

          Specifies the maximum number of characters to accept.
          Type:
          int

        • maxLines

          Maximum number of lines to show.
          Type:
          int

        • minLines

          Minimum number of lines to show.
          Type:
          int

        • rawInputType

          Type of data being placed in a text field, used to help an input method decide how to let the user enter text. This prop will override inputType if both are provided.
          Type:
          int

        • requestFocus

          If set, attempts to give focus.
          Type:
          boolean

        • selection

          Moves the cursor to the selection index.
          Type:
          int

        • shadowColor

          Color for the shadow underneath the text.
          Type:
          int

        • shadowDx

          Horizontal offset of the shadow.
          Type:
          float

        • shadowDy

          Vertical offset of the shadow.
          Type:
          float

        • shadowRadius

          Blur radius of the shadow.
          Type:
          float

        • spacingMultiplier

          Extra spacing between the lines of text, as a multiplier.
          Type:
          float

        • stateUpdatePolicy

          A policy describing when and how internal state should be updated. This does violate encapsulation, but is essential for optimization, so costly state updates, which trigger relayout, happen only when is really needed.
          Type:
          com.facebook.litho.widget.EditTextStateUpdatePolicy

        • text

          Text to display; changing this overrides and replaces the current text. Leave this as null to signal that the EditText's text property should be left untouched.
          Type:
          java.lang.CharSequence

        • textAlignment

          Alignment of the text within its container.
          Type:
          android.text.Layout.Alignment

        • textColor

          Color of the text.
          Type:
          int

        • textColorStateList

          ColorStateList of the text.
          Type:
          android.content.res.ColorStateList

        • textSize

          Size of the text.
          Type:
          int

        • textStyle

          Style (bold, italic, bolditalic) for the text.
          Type:
          int

        • textWatchers

          Type:
          java.util.List

        • tintColorStateList

          Type:
          android.content.res.ColorStateList

        • typeface

          Typeface for the text.
          Type:
          android.graphics.Typeface

      • isEquivalentTo

        public boolean isEquivalentTo(Component other)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from class: Component
        Compares this component to a different one to check if they are the same

        This is used to be able to skip rendering a component again. We avoid using the Object.equals(Object) so we can optimize the code better over time since we don't have to adhere to the contract required for a equals method.

        Specified by:
        isEquivalentTo in interface Equivalence<Component>
        Overrides:
        isEquivalentTo in class Component
        Parameters:
        other - the component to compare to
        Returns:
        true if the components are of the same type and have the same props
